title: Kindreds Passive and consistancy
body:
What.
Kindred's passive where enemy camps can be hunted for stacks of Mark of Kindreds should exclude rift herald and baron nashor.
Why.
hunting enemy camps for stacks is primarily how kindred (at least for me) consistently gets stacks early since ganking can be hard with counter ganks and wards etc. in the most extreme case I have experienced; at around 16min mark the hunted camp was rift herald. I finally got 2 team mates to help me kill it but the enemy jungler alone stopped that attempt. 20 min baron Nashor appeared, became the hunted camp. At 25 Min the hunt mark disappeared presumably to rng another camp to hunt but Baron Nashor again and I couldn't hunt.
The game ended shortly after 31min. from aprox. 16 min till the end of the match the Hunted camp was rift herald/Baron, 15 minutes of not being able to get stacks from enemy camps I had fallen so far behind I was useless.
I feel that this is not a matter of personal skill or counter skill by the opponent but rather a rng pimpslap against Kindred.

Running count of times hunted camp has landed on Baron and NEVER moved after: 3

replies.body: Sorry hewk, I see so many more kindred players in high plat. I see them constantly gank. And as a result they usually snowball and win.

After getting 6 marks (from either champions or camps) marks will **no longer spawn in jungle camps**. (to prevent you just farming up and becoming invincible) 

The marks on baron nashor and rift herald are 'on top of' not 'instead of' normal camps, hence they are a buff to kindred, not a disadvantage. They will NOT prevent you hunting other camps.

the marks on baron and herald are the only jungle camps that will spawn marks after you reach 6 stacks.
try doing proper ganks with her then
Really?! this isn't about the ganking part of Kindred's passive
I have to agree with talon12 I get 6/10+ stakes from ganking in a game were as only 3/6 from camps
